column5: I got this pic from another site....thought the art work was awsome and wanted to share....this rod was custom made by cplummer on this board.  I have seen several of his custom rods on another forum and have finally decided to buy one for myself....this rod I think is a frontier X  which is a great quality rod.  Hope you guys enjoy this pick  like I did....  [/url  if you guys want a nice custom built rod I would contact him, I have priced these rods and he is hard to beat for prices.
thanks charlie ..that pic was an incomplete pic and it was the beginning of the birth of a new custom rod.. heres a pic of that butt wrap completed..   cliff..
Very very nice indeed Cliff !!  Your obviously a man of both talent and patience.
Very nice work.   Hope to be able to even attempt that someday.
been doing it alot of years now it's a part time job.. thanks for the kind words.. cliff...
....Nice work indeed Cliff. I've always been partial to a well tied chevron and that one fits the bill.
Wow, that is a awesome job cplummer! Can you pm me, I might be intrested. I will let you know the details.

very nice,thats great work,its an art and you look very good   at it,there is nothing better than the feel of your own custom made rod,with all the wrap and your name on it,i have a custom made lews ,11ft noodle rod and man its awsome .  ...keep up the great work....cheers
WOW Cliff you are an artist, awesome work.  Regards, Sam

That certainly is a beautiful piece of work, Cliff. The best muskie trolling rod I have was custom made for me by Spiel. The pic certainly doesn't do it justice but it really is a super rod....it's a 7'7" G.Loomis blank.
We sure d have some artistes on this 'Board. Very nice work!!!

Nice work Cliff it is looking good. I have known that Spiel makes a nice rod and I received one for Christmas this year. Then ordered one for Joes Birthday so going to Lak Air is really exciting this year to pick them up. I have always been a big fan of hand made items it just seems that the product is more alive than a machine wrapped product. While my budget will allow very few handmade rods the few that I get will always be cherished because of how and who made them.  Art
